00058 ** Type definition (system time)...
00059 */

00071 typedef struct
00072 {
00073   uint32  Seconds;            
00074   uint32  Subseconds;         
00075 } CFE_TIME_SysTime_t;
00076 
00077 /*
00078 ** Type definition (clock state)...
00079 */
00094 typedef enum  
00095 {
00096   CFE_TIME_INVALID  = -1,     
00100   CFE_TIME_VALID    =  0,     
00104   CFE_TIME_FLYWHEEL =  1      
00109 } CFE_TIME_ClockState_t;
00110 
00111 /*
00112 ** Type definition (time comparison results)...
00113 */
00122 typedef enum  
00123 {
00124   CFE_TIME_A_LT_B  = -1,      
00125   CFE_TIME_EQUAL   =  0,      
00126   CFE_TIME_A_GT_B  =  1       
00127 } CFE_TIME_Compare_t;
00128 
00129 /*
00130 ** Type definition (time portion the ES Reset data structure)
00131 */
00140 typedef struct
00141 {
00142   uint32 Signature;                     
00143   int16  LeapSeconds;                   
00144   uint16 ClockSignal;                   
00145   CFE_TIME_SysTime_t CurrentMET;        
00146   CFE_TIME_SysTime_t CurrentSTCF;       
00147   CFE_TIME_SysTime_t CurrentDelay;      
00149 } CFE_TIME_ResetVars_t;
00150 
00159 typedef int32 (*CFE_TIME_SynchCallbackPtr_t)(void);

00162 ** Function prototypes (get time)...

00164 /*****************************************************************************/
00187 CFE_TIME_SysTime_t  CFE_TIME_GetTime(void);   /* returns default time (see default time selection above) */
00188 
00189 /*****************************************************************************/
00219 CFE_TIME_SysTime_t  CFE_TIME_GetTAI(void);    /* returns time computed as TAI (MET + STCF) */
00220 
00221 /*****************************************************************************/
00248 CFE_TIME_SysTime_t  CFE_TIME_GetUTC(void);    /* returns time computed as UTC (MET + STCF - Leap Seconds) */
00249 
00250 /*****************************************************************************/
00273 CFE_TIME_SysTime_t CFE_TIME_MET2SCTime (CFE_TIME_SysTime_t METTime); /* returns given MET time as the default spacecraft time */
00274

00276 ** Function prototypes (get parts of time)...
00277 */
00278 
00279 /*****************************************************************************/
00301 CFE_TIME_SysTime_t  CFE_TIME_GetSTCF(void);   /* returns STCF (does not include leap seconds calculation) */
00302 
00303 /*****************************************************************************/
00325 CFE_TIME_SysTime_t  CFE_TIME_GetMET(void);    /* returns MET (both seconds and sub-seconds) */
00326 
00327 
00328 /*****************************************************************************/
00347 uint32  CFE_TIME_GetMETseconds(void);         /* returns MET "seconds" portion of current time */
00348 
00349 /*****************************************************************************/
00369 uint32  CFE_TIME_GetMETsubsecs(void);         /* returns MET "sub-seconds" portion of current time */
00370 
00371 /*****************************************************************************/
00397 int16   CFE_TIME_GetLeapSeconds(void);        /* returns Leap Seconds portion of current time */

00491 
00492 /*****************************************************************************/
00521 CFE_TIME_SysTime_t  CFE_TIME_Subtract(CFE_TIME_SysTime_t Time1, CFE_TIME_SysTime_t Time2);  /* (Time1 - Time2) */

00523 /*****************************************************************************/
00560 CFE_TIME_Compare_t  CFE_TIME_Compare(CFE_TIME_SysTime_t TimeA, CFE_TIME_SysTime_t TimeB);   /* (TimeA <=> TimeB) */

00735 /*
00736 ** Function prototypes (external time source)...
00737 **
00738 ** If a Time Server has been configured to accept external time
00739 **    data, then one of the following functions will be enabled.
00740 **
00741 ** If the Time Server has also been commanded to use the external
00742 **    time data (as opposed to getting time data from a local MET)
00743 **    then the Time Server will use the external data in computing
00744 **    time.
00745 **
00746 ** However, regardless whether the external time data is accepted
00747 **    by the Time Server, these functions also act as the signal to
00748 **    create and distribute the "time at the tone" command packet.
00749 */
00750 #ifdef CFE_TIME_CFG_SRC_MET
00751 
00752 /*****************************************************************************/
00785 void CFE_TIME_ExternalMET(CFE_TIME_SysTime_t NewMET);
00786 #endif
00787 
00788 #ifdef CFE_TIME_CFG_SRC_GPS
00789 
00790 /*****************************************************************************/
00826 void CFE_TIME_ExternalGPS(CFE_TIME_SysTime_t NewTime, int16 NewLeaps);
00827 #endif
00828 
00829 #ifdef CFE_TIME_CFG_SRC_TIME
00830 
00831 /*****************************************************************************/
00865 void CFE_TIME_ExternalTime(CFE_TIME_SysTime_t NewTime);
00866 #endif
00867 
00868 /*****************************************************************************/
00889 int32  CFE_TIME_RegisterSynchCallback(CFE_TIME_SynchCallbackPtr_t CallbackFuncPtr);   
00890 
00891 
00892 /*****************************************************************************/
00913 int32  CFE_TIME_UnregisterSynchCallback(CFE_TIME_SynchCallbackPtr_t CallbackFuncPtr);
